citation.article-title: Zavarzinella formosa gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel stalked, Gemmata-like planctomycete from a Siberian peat bog.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Zavarzinella (Za.var.zi.nel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Zavarzinella, named in honour of the famous Russian microbiologist George A. Zavarzin, for his outstanding contribution to increasing our knowledge of microbial diversity).
Ellipsoid cells occur singly or are assembled in large rosette-like clusters.
Daughter cells are motile by means of one or two flagella.
Produce unusual type of stalk-like structures.
Cells attach to surfaces by means of amorphous holdfast material.
Major fatty acids are C18 : 0, C18 : 1ω5c and C16 : 1ω5c.
Member of the phylum Planctomycetes, order Planctomycetales, family Planctomycetaceae.
The type species is Zavarzinella formosa.
